overview.problem_statement: Current habit tracking apps frustrate users with artificial limits on habit counts in free versions, complex gamification that becomes overwhelming, and unreliable data syncing causing lost progress
overview.solution_approach: Unlimited visual habit tracking using colored dots with offline-first architecture and simple one-tap completion, keeping core features forever free
overview.value_proposition: Unlimited visual habit tracking using colored dots without artificial restrictions or complex features
overview.target_audience: Habit tracking enthusiasts and neurodivergent users frustrated by app limitations and complex interfaces

core_features.description: Create and track unlimited habits without restrictions or upgrade prompts
core_features.user_story: As a user, I want to add as many habits as I need to track without hitting artificial limits

core_features.description: Calendar view showing colored dots for habit completion with clear streak patterns
core_features.user_story: As a user, I want to see my habit progress in a visual calendar using colored dots

core_features.description: One-tap habit completion marking with visual feedback and undo capability
core_features.user_story: As a user, I want to mark habits complete with a single tap

core_features.description: Simple streak counter with milestone celebrations without overwhelming gamification
core_features.user_story: As a user, I want to see my current and best streaks clearly

core_features.description: All data stored locally without internet dependency or sync failures
core_features.user_story: As a user, I want my habit data to work reliably offline

core_features.description: Advanced insights into habit patterns and correlations for premium users
core_features.user_story: As a premium user, I want deeper insights into my habit patterns

core_features.description: Export habit data to CSV or other formats for external analysis
core_features.user_story: As a power user, I want to export my data for external analysis

user_personas.demographics: Adults 25-45 focused on self-improvement and building consistent routines
pain_points: Artificial limits on number of habits in free versions
Complex gamification and RPG elements getting overwhelming
Data syncing problems and widget failures
Premium subscription required for basic unlimited tracking
goals: Track multiple habits without paying monthly fees
Reliable data saving without sync issues
user_personas.usage_patterns: Daily 2-3 minute check-ins to mark habit completion and view progress patterns

user_personas.demographics: Users with ADHD, autism, or other neurodivergent conditions needing flexible tracking
pain_points: Habits tied to specific days rather than flexible schedules
Complex interfaces with steep learning curves
goals: Flexible habit scheduling that accommodates varying routines
user_personas.usage_patterns: Irregular check-ins based on personal schedule and energy levels, focusing on visual progress patterns

standards_compliance.subscription_store_compliance: Clear distinction between forever-free core features (unlimited habit tracking) and premium analytics features, ensuring subscription provides ongoing value without artificial limits
standards_compliance.accessibility_design: Large tap targets for habit marking, high contrast dot visualization, support for VoiceOver and screen readers, customizable text sizes
standards_compliance.privacy_analytics: All habit data stored locally on device by default, analytics data collection optional and clearly disclosed, no personal data shared without explicit consent
standards_compliance.testing_release_readiness: Comprehensive testing of offline functionality, data persistence across app updates, and subscription flow validation before store submission
